title: EU AI Act Scope of Application
description: Foundational determination of whether the EU AI Act applies at all

logical_structure.description: Regulation applies if ANY scope pathway is satisfied AND NO exclusion applies

requirements.description: At least one of seven alternative scope pathways must be satisfied

pathways.description: Provider placing on market or putting into service AI systems/GP AI models in the Union

conditions.element: places on market OR puts into service
AI system OR general-purpose AI model

pathways.irrespective_of: Whether provider established or located in Union or third country

pathways.description: Deployers with place of establishment or located in the Union

conditions.element: place of establishment OR located within Union

pathways.description: Extraterritorial application where output used in Union

conditions.element: place of establishment OR located in third country
output produced by the AI system
conditions.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: What constitutes 'output'? System-generated predictions, recommendations, decisions, content.

conditions.element: output is used in the Union
conditions.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: 'used in Union' requires interpretation - mere data flow? Material reliance? Web services accessed from Union?

pathways.note: Extraterritorial reach provision - critical for non-EU providers

pathways.description: Importers and distributors of AI systems

conditions.note: Both definitions specify 'in the Union' so territorial nexus built-in

pathways.description: Product manufacturers placing AI system on market with their product

conditions.flag: LOW_CONFIDENCE: Not explicitly defined in Art 3. Appears to mean manufacturer of non-AI product incorporating AI.

conditions.element: places on market OR puts into service
AI system together with their product

conditions.note: This condition makes product manufacturer assume provider responsibilities

conditions.element: of provider not established in Union

pathways.description: Affected persons located in Union (rights-granting provision)

conditions.note: Not explicitly defined - appears to mean natural persons subject to or impacted by AI systems

pathways.legal_effect: Grants rights and protection, not obligations

requirements.description: None of the exclusions in Article 2(2)-(12) apply
requirements.note: Must check all exclusions - if any applies, scope defeated

metadata.used_by: All provisions of EU AI Act
metadata.confidence_overall: HIGH with specific low-confidence elements flagged
